message: {'description': 'TestMatrix captures all details about a test. It contains the environment configuration, test specification, test executions and overall state and outcome.', 'properties': {'clientInfo': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/ClientInfo', 'description': 'Information about the client which invoked the test.'}, 'environmentMatrix': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/EnvironmentMatrix', 'description': 'Required. The devices the tests are being executed on.'}, 'extendedInvalidMatrixDetails': {'description': 'Output only. Details about why a matrix was deemed invalid. If multiple checks can be safely performed, they will be reported but no assumptions should be made about the length of this list.', 'items': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/MatrixErrorDetail'}, 'readOnly': True, 'type': 'array'}, 'failFast': {'description': 'If true, only a single attempt at most will be made to run each execution/shard in the matrix. Flaky test attempts are not affected. Normally, 2 or more attempts are made if a potential infrastructure issue is detected. This feature is for latency sensitive workloads. The incidence of execution failures may be significantly greater for fail-fast matrices and support is more limited because of that expectation.', 'type': 'boolean'}, 'flakyTestAttempts': {'description': 'The number of times a TestExecution should be re-attempted if one or more of its test cases fail for any reason. The maximum number of reruns allowed is 10. Default is 0, which implies no reruns.', 'format': 'int32', 'type': 'integer'}, 'invalidMatrixDetails': {'description': 'Output only. Describes why the matrix is considered invalid. Only useful for matrices in the INVALID state.', 'enum': ['INVALID_MATRIX_DETAILS_UNSPECIFIED', 'DETAILS_UNAVAILABLE', 'MALFORMED_APK', 'MALFORMED_TEST_APK', 'NO_MANIFEST', 'NO_PACKAGE_NAME', 'INVALID_PACKAGE_NAME', 'TEST_SAME_AS_APP', 'NO_INSTRUMENTATION', 'NO_SIGNATURE', 'INSTRUMENTATION_ORCHESTRATOR_INCOMPATIBLE', 'NO_TEST_RUNNER_CLASS', 'NO_LAUNCHER_ACTIVITY', 'FORBIDDEN_PERMISSIONS', 'INVALID_ROBO_DIRECTIVES', 'INVALID_RESOURCE_NAME', 'INVALID_DIRECTIVE_ACTION', 'TEST_LOOP_INTENT_FILTER_NOT_FOUND', 'SCENARIO_LABEL_NOT_DECLARED', 'SCENARIO_LABEL_MALFORMED', 'SCENARIO_NOT_DECLARED', 'DEVICE_ADMIN_RECEIVER', 'MALFORMED_XC_TEST_ZIP', 'BUILT_FOR_IOS_SIMULATOR', 'NO_TESTS_IN_XC_TEST_ZIP', 'USE_DESTINATION_ARTIFACTS', 'TEST_NOT_APP_HOSTED', 'PLIST_CANNOT_BE_PARSED', 'TEST_ONLY_APK', 'MALFORMED_IPA', 'MISSING_URL_SCHEME', 'MALFORMED_APP_BUNDLE', 'NO_CODE_APK', 'INVALID_INPUT_APK', 'INVALID_APK_PREVIEW_SDK', 'MATRIX_TOO_LARGE', 'TEST_QUOTA_EXCEEDED', 'SERVICE_NOT_ACTIVATED', 'UNKNOWN_PERMISSION_ERROR'], 'enumDeprecated': [False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, True, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False, False], 'type': 'string'}, 'outcomeSummary': {'description': 'Output Only. The overall outcome of the test. Only set when the test matrix state is FINISHED.', 'enum': ['OUTCOME_SUMMARY_UNSPECIFIED', 'SUCCESS', 'FAILURE', 'INCONCLUSIVE', 'SKIPPED'], 'type': 'string'}, 'projectId': {'description': 'The cloud project that owns the test matrix.', 'type': 'string'}, 'resultStorage': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/ResultStorage', 'description': 'Required. Where the results for the matrix are written.'}, 'state': {'description': 'Output only. Indicates the current progress of the test matrix.', 'enum': ['TEST_STATE_UNSPECIFIED', 'VALIDATING', 'PENDING', 'RUNNING', 'FINISHED', 'ERROR', 'UNSUPPORTED_ENVIRONMENT', 'INCOMPATIBLE_ENVIRONMENT', 'INCOMPATIBLE_ARCHITECTURE', 'CANCELLED', 'INVALID'], 'type': 'string'}, 'testExecutions': {'description': 'Output only. The list of test executions that the service creates for this matrix.', 'items': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/TestExecution'}, 'type': 'array'}, 'testMatrixId': {'description': 'Output only. Unique id set by the service.', 'type': 'string'}, 'testSpecification': {'$ref': '#/components/schemas/TestSpecification', 'description': 'Required. How to run the test.'}, 'timestamp': {'description': 'Output only. Operation 'testing.projects.deviceSessions.cancel' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description includes useful details about state change and retention policy but lacks clarity on what is returned and prerequisites. Improved summary is action-oriented. Enhanced description clarifies the operation's effect, retention behavior, state requirements, and return value for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: POST /v1/projects/{project_id}/deviceSessions/{device_session_id}:cancel Changes the DeviceSession to state FINISHED and terminates all connections. Canceled sessions are not deleted and can be retrieved or listed by the user until they expire based on the 28 day deletion policy.
data.summary_suggestion: Cancel a device session and terminate connections
data.description_suggestion: Terminates an active device session by changing its state to FINISHED and closing all active connections. The canceled session is retained and remains queryable for 28 days before automatic deletion. Requires the device session to be in an active state. Returns the updated DeviceSession object with state FINISHED.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description includes useful details about state change and retention policy but lacks clarity on what is returned and prerequisites. Improved summary is action-oriented. Enhanced description clarifies the operation's effect, retention behavior, state requirements, and return value for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'testing.projects.deviceSessions.list' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is minimal and lacks details about pagination, filtering capabilities, ordering, and return structure. Enhanced version clarifies pagination support, filtering options, return format, and sort order to help AI agents understand filtering and pagination capabilities.

data.current_description: GET /v1/projects/{project_id}/deviceSessions Lists device Sessions owned by the project user.
data.summary_suggestion: List device sessions for a project
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all DeviceSession objects owned by the authenticated user within the specified project. Supports filtering and pagination through query parameters. Returns a list of DeviceSession objects with their current states and metadata. Sessions are ordered by creation time in descending order.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is minimal and lacks details about pagination, filtering capabilities, ordering, and return structure. Enhanced version clarifies pagination support, filtering options, return format, and sort order to help AI agents understand filtering and pagination capabilities.

message: Operation 'testing.projects.deviceSessions.create' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Missing summary entirely. Description is extremely minimal - only shows the endpoint path with no explanation of purpose, inputs, outputs, or effects. Enhanced version explains the operation creates a device session, clarifies the request schema (DeviceSession), describes device provisioning behavior, specifies the return value and initial state, and notes the asynchronous nature of device allocation for better AI agent interpretability.

data.description_suggestion: Creates a new DeviceSession for the specified project, allocating a physical or virtual device for testing. Accepts a DeviceSession request object specifying device configuration, test environment, and session parameters. The operation provisions the device and establishes connections for test execution. Returns the created DeviceSession object with a unique session ID and initial state ACTIVE. Session allocation may take several seconds to complete.

data.current_description: Creates and runs a matrix of tests according to the given specifications. Unsupported environments will be returned in the state UNSUPPORTED. A test matrix is limited to use at most 2000 devices in parallel. The returned matrix will not yet contain the executions that will be created for this matrix. Execution creation happens later on and will require a call to GetTestMatrix. May return any of the following canonical error codes: - PERMISSION_DENIED - if the user is not authorized to write to project - INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the request is malformed or if the matrix tries to use too many simultaneous devices.
data.summary_suggestion: Create and initiate a test matrix execution
